{"step_by_step_thinking": "In this case, the infant has a leaky meningomyelocele, which refers to a leakage of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the defect in the back. The most useful test for diagnosis and management of this condition would be to perform a wound swab culture and sensitivity. This test would help identify the specific microorganisms causing the infection and guide appropriate antibiotic treatment. Blood culture and sensitivity, urine culture and sensitivity, and rectal swab culture and sensitivity may not provide accurate information about the infection at the site of the meningomyelocele.", "answer_choice": "D"}
